sentences: Vere hübimist takistav aine on antikoagulant.
context: The word 'vere' is the genitive singular form of 'veri', which means 'blood'. In Estonian, genitive case indicates possession or relationship. When used in medical contexts like 'anti|koagulant keem med', it can refer to anticoagulants - substances that prevent blood coagulation or clotting.
